articles.description: The "Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History" order removes "divisive, race-centered ideology" from Smithsonian museums, educational and research centers, and the National Zoo.

articles.title: A Video From Tufts Captures the Fear and Aggression in Trump’s Crackdown
articles.description: The tactics on display in the arrest of Rumeysa Ozturk were not new — plainclothes officers, faces obscured — but as ICE actions ramp up, scrutiny may increase.
articles.content:

articles.title: Yolanda Saldívar, who killed Tejano icon Selena, is denied parole : NPR
articles.description: Yolanda Saldívar, the woman convicted of killing Selena Quintanilla-Perez, has been denied parole after spending decades behind bars for fatally shooting the young singer at a Texas motel in 1995.

articles.description: The University of Michigan said it is closing two offices and an effort tied to diversity, equity and inclusion and shifting the resources elsewhere.

articles.title: Selena's Killer Yolanda Saldívar Denied Parole, Will Not Be Released from Prison
articles.description: Yolanda Saldivar was convicted for the murder of singer Selena and sentenced to life in prison with the possibility of parole in 30 years in 1995. The Texas Board of Pardons and Parole told PEOPLE on Thursday the reason her parole was denied.
articles.content:
The woman who murdered Tejano singer Selena Quintanilla-Perez in 1995 was denied early release from prison on Thursday, March 27.
